title: 3D Texture Generator Tool

requirements.text: Create a backend actor that stores texture generation presets and history. Each entry should include: material name, material type (metal, wood, fabric, stone, plastic, organic, etc.), generation parameters (roughness, metalness, color palette, pattern style, tiling scale), and a timestamp.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes functions to save, retrieve, and delete texture presets
Each preset stores material type, name, parameters, and timestamp

requirements.text: Build a Texture Generator page where users can select a material category (metal, wood, stone, fabric, plastic, organic, ceramic, concrete, etc.), configure texture parameters (base color, roughness, metalness, bump intensity, pattern scale, color variation), and preview the resulting texture on a 3D sphere rendered with Three.js / React Three Fiber using the configured PBR material properties.
acceptanceCriteria: Material category selector with at least 8 categories is visible
Parameter sliders/inputs for roughness, metalness, bump intensity, color, pattern scale are available
A 3D sphere in the viewport updates in real time to reflect the configured texture parameters
The sphere can be rotated by dragging to inspect the texture from all angles

requirements.text: Provide a texture export panel that lets users download generated texture maps (Albedo/Diffuse, Normal, Roughness, Metalness) as PNG files suitable for import into 3D software. Each map should be generated as a canvas-based image from the current parameter settings.
acceptanceCriteria: Export buttons are available for Albedo, Normal, Roughness, and Metalness maps
Clicking an export button downloads the corresponding PNG file
Exported PNG files are at least 512x512 pixels

requirements.text: Add a Presets Library panel where users can save the current texture configuration with a custom name, browse previously saved presets, load a preset to restore its parameters, and delete presets. Presets should be persisted in the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Save Preset button opens a dialog to name and save the current configuration
Presets Library lists all saved presets with material type and name
Clicking a preset loads its parameters into the generator
Delete action removes the preset from both UI and backend

requirements.text: Apply a dark industrial / technical visual theme inspired by professional 3D software tools. Use a dark charcoal and slate color palette with amber/orange accent highlights, monospace or semi-technical typography, and a panel-based layout with a central 3D viewport. Enforce the style consistently across all pages and components.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages use a dark background (charcoal / near-black)
Accent colors are consistently amber or orange
Layout follows a panel-based structure with a prominent central 3D viewport
Typography is consistent and technical in style throughout

constraints: Do not integrate any external AI/LLM services for texture generation — all texture generation must be procedural using canvas-based algorithms and Three.js material properties
All backend logic must remain in a single Motoko actor
nonGoals: Cloud rendering or server-side texture baking
UV unwrapping or mesh editing features

required: App logo mark — abstract geometric mesh grid forming a cube or sphere, dark background with amber/orange accent lines, technical style (texturecraft-logo.dim_256x256.png)
